course.subject: SOSC
course.name: China in the Global Political Economy
course.description: This course examines China's political economic development from a global political economy perspective. It introduces major theories in the field of global political economy; analyzes causes, trends, and consequences of China's political and economic development since 1978.
course.prerequisites: HUMA 2590 OR SOSC 1350 OR SOSC 2290

reviews.author: ching_tc
reviews.comment_content:
interpret political science from different point of view i.e., economic nationalism, liberalism, Marxism
many discussion on issues like US-China trade war, multi-national corporation, Belt and Road Initiatives
quite interactive throughout the whole course
the content is not too heavy if you have taken some political courses previously (i mean 3000s level up)
reviews.comment_teaching:
James Wong's teaching no doubt is not too boring
he is also quite willing to answer your question outside the classroom and give you some comments about it
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is fair
the mean is very high this semester (> 80% for both quizzes)
reviews.comment_workload:
1 group project
2 quizzes
4 pop quizzes
10mins pitch

reviews.author: Soyeon
reviews.comment_content: Economic and political theories, different economic perspectives, current political economy of China
reviews.comment_teaching: Speaks really fast, but listening to him attentively helps you understand the theories.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading mainly depends on the effort you put on your term paper; make sure you prepare well for the essay consulting session, because he gives good advice only if you have something specific in mind regarding the paper topic;
midterm is basically memorizing the ppt; ppt is very detailed so no need to worry about missing classes
reviews.comment_workload: one midterm, group presentation, term paper
